clinical_study.brief_title: The Impact of Baby-friendly Hospital Initiative to Breastfeeding, Breastfeeding Counselling and Breastfeeding Attitudes
clinical_study.official_title: Vauvamy√∂nteisyysohjelman Vaikutus Imetykseen, Imetysohjaukseen ja Imetysasenteisiin / The Impact of Baby-friendly Hospital Initiative to Breastfeeding, Breastfeeding Counselling and Breastfeeding Attitudes

brief_summary.textblock: The impact of Baby-friendly Hospital Initiative (BFHI) to breastfeeding, breastfeeding counselling and breastfeeding attitudes will be examined in Satakunta Central Hospital, Finland. The baseline measurement will be conducted before the implementation of BFHI in 2017 and second measurement will be conducted in 2019 after the certification process. Both staff members and breastfeeding mothers will be recruited in the study. The main outcomes are the duration of breastfeeding and breastfeeding attitudes.

primary_outcome.description: Duration of breastfeeding will be asked from the mother

secondary_outcome.description: Attitude will be measured with a structured questionnaire
Attitude will be measured with a structured and validated questionnaire

arm_group.description: The mothers who will give birth at the study hospital and all the staff members taking care about mothers and/or infants

intervention.description: The intervention is Baby-friendly Hospital Initiative as described by WHO and UNICEF. The ten steps to successful breastfeeding will be implemented in the hospital.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Staff: All staff members taking care of mothers and/or infants in the hospital.
- Mothers: Mothers who have given birth in the study hospital during the data collection period.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Mothers:
- who have given birth outside the hospital,
- whose infant's condition is critical,
- whose infants are transferred to another unit.
